qas.question: What rediscoveries inspired interior designs of neoclassicism?
What tightly controlled book brought appeal for classic interior to masses?

answers.text: Le Antichità di Ercolano (The Antiquities of Herculaneum).

qas.question: What are some examples of the changes of interior of neoclassicism from ancient rediscoveries?

answers.text: pedimented window frames turned into gilded mirrors, fireplaces topped with temple fronts

qas.question: What were William Kent's interior designs based from?

answers.text: basilica and temple exterior architecture turned outside in

qas.question: What re-discoveries inspired exterior design of neoclassicism
What gained a wider audience in 1740s?
What were classic exteriors of the Baroque based on?

plausible_answers.text: pedimented window frames turned into gilded mirrors, fireplaces topped with temple fronts

qas.question: What are examples of classic interior design?

context: Indoors, neoclassicism made a discovery of <b5_0>the genuine classic interior<b5_0/>, inspired by the rediscoveries at <a0_0><b4_0>Pompeii and Herculaneum<b4_0/>.<a0_0/> These had begun in the late 1740s, but only achieved a wide audience in the 1760s, with the first luxurious volumes of tightly controlled distribution of <a1_0>Le Antichità di Ercolano (The Antiquities of Herculaneum).<a1_0/> The antiquities of Herculaneum showed that even the most classicising interiors of the Baroque, or the most "Roman" rooms of William Kent were based on <a3_0><b6_0>basilica and temple exterior architecture<b6_0/> turned outside in<a3_0/>, hence their often bombastic appearance to modern eyes: <a2_0><b7_0>pedimented window frames turned into gilded mirrors, fireplaces topped with temple fronts<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
